content.text:
# Draft:Queen Angelique-Monét Gureje-Thompson

Queen Angelique-Monét Gureje-Thompson is an American of African descent who is married to Oba Dokun Thompson, the Oloni of Eti-Oni in Atakumosa East Local Government Area, Osun State, Nigeria. She is also referred to as Yeyeluwa Olori of Eti-Oni, a title given to the wife of a monarch. She has a interest in providing humanitarian services as well as arts and entertainment.
Early life and childhood
Queen Angelique-Monét Gureje-Thompson was born in Nashville Tennessee, and raised in Greenville, South Carolina to the family of American politicians and political household of civil rights leaders. As a little girl, she was bullied and this resulted in her inability to speak until the age of five(5). She also suffered learning disability which resulted in being enroled in speech therapy. She overcame these obstacles through the art of mastering ventriloquism and learning classical music at age nine.
Education
She has a a Bachelor's degree in mass communications from Saint Augustine's University in Raleigh, North Carolina.
